intro: Capnoides leptocarpa, commonly known as the slender-leaved capnoid, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Capnoides leptocarpa is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid climates.
